title: For Indian Americans, Modi visit sparks pride — and frustration
description: Biden’s embrace of Narendra Modi overshadowed warnings from human rights groups, and former president Barack Obama, that India may be a brittle U.S. partner.

title: Ramzi Choueiri, who brought foodie celebrity to Arab world, dies at 52
description: For millions of food lovers across the Arab world, "Chef Ramzi" was their first celebrity in the kitchen.

title: Wagner mercenary boss faces arrest over ‘incitement to armed rebellion’
description: A feud between Yevgeniy Prigozhin and Russian military leaders threatened to spill into open warfare. The Kremlin said President Vladimir Putin was briefed and "necessary measures" were being taken.

title: Indian politician’s tweet targets Barack Obama and Indian Muslims
description: Obama raised questions about India's treatment of its Muslim population. An Indian politician said police should focus on the "many Hussain Obama” in India.

title: James Cameron: ‘I wouldn’t have gotten in’ Titan submersible
description: The "Titanic" director, an experienced deep-sea explorer who has visited the ship’s wreckage site many times, said OceanGate "cut corners" with its submersible.

title: Hundreds of Dolly Parton imitators gather in Irish town to set world record
description: Dolly Day organizers in Listowel, Ireland, have a tip for impersonators pursuing a Guinness World Record: “If in doubt, think ‘Am I serving Dolly Parton?’”

title: Russia makes a land grab ... in Canberra, Australia
description: A staffer from Russia's embassy has been squatting on government property after Australia's parliament, citing national security concerns, cancelled a lease for land where a new embassy was to be built.

title: The race to extract an Indigenous language from its last lucid speaker
description: Linguist Roberto Zariquiey has been meeting with Nelita Campos for more than a decade to record all she knows of the Iskonawa language.

title: Spain rescues scores of migrants from capsized boats near Canary Islands
description: Multiple boats sank this week between Africa and Spain’s Canary Islands, leaving at least two people dead and many more missing, officials and activists said.

title: Sweltering Beijingers turn to bean soup and cushion fans to combat heat
description: Chinese weather authorities have issued a red alert for the weekend, warning that temperatures in Beijing will exceed 104 degrees Fahrenheit (40 Celsius).

title: Mattel once sued over the ‘Barbie Girl’ song — before learning to love it
description: The “Barbie Girl” lawsuit — and a judge’s advice that the parties “chill” — amused many but also contributed to what experts call an important precedent related to free speech.

title: After Taliban bans opium, a guilt-racked commander winks at harvest
description: The case of a war-torn village in eastern Afghanistan shows how the poppy eradication effort can be undermined by dissent and small acts of sympathy.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Missiles strike ‘Gate to Crimea’ bridge, a critical link for Russia
description: A Ukrainian official said the attack on the bridge was a blow to Russian logistics and a sign the counteroffensive could become more dynamic in the south.

title: Violence in Israel puts spotlight on the ‘one-state’ reality
description: A growing body of mainstream scholars view the prevailing situation in Israel as that of a “one-state” reality where Palestinians live under the Israeli thumb in what some rights organizations describe as “apartheid”-like conditions.

title: Meta says it will block news from Facebook, Instagram in Canada
description: The announcement follows the passage of legislation Thursday requiring social media platforms to pay news organizations for their content.
